projective adjective
(GEOMETRY)
mathematics , architecture
  specialized relating to or involving the way a line, figure, or solid is shown on a given plane (= a flat or level surface that continues in all directions): V will denote a flat projective scheme over B. They questioned the dominance of perspective as a projective representation of proposed architecture.
projective adjective
(PSYCHOLOGY)
psychology
  specialized relating to or involving projection (= the act of encouraging someone to express their feelings and desires): Projective techniques are based on Freudian theory. The illustrations were specifically designed to be projective in nature.
psychology
  specialized relating to or involving projection (= the act of imagining that someone else feels a particular emotion or wants something when in fact it is you who feels this way): The more one partner complains about the behaviour of the other, the more likely it is that a projective system is in operation. We noted his projective criticism of the project and its contributors.
